Posts.Content: Jul 26, 2011 04:40PM EllieD wrote: Hi Chrys, I worked through chemo too.  Same regime as you're going to have, TC.  I had the infusion on Thursdays, came back to work on Friday, and laid low on Saturday and Sunday.  I could usually go back on Mondays.  It felt like a bad flu - headache and fatigue.  I can't say that I was functioning at 100%, but I was there and keeping things together. I am the director of a social service agency. The chemo brain got to me, but cleared up eventually.  Good luck and hugs to you.
Posts.Title: Poll: How many ladies worked through Chemo? Chrys23 Chrys23

Posts.Content: Jan 4, 2011 03:31PM EllieD wrote: I was diagnosed in 2007 at age 57.  Because my tumor was grade 3, and my oncotype was 27, I chose to have chemo.  I did TCx4.  I worked while I was having chemo.  I had to take a couple days off each cycle, but I was able to get through it.  When your oncotype is in the middle, it becomes a personal decision.  Do your research and be true to yourself.  I knew I would beat myself up if I didn't do chemo and had a recurrence.  I'm at peace with my decision.  Hang in there!
Posts.Title: If you were stage I, did you get chemo??? mdg SusansGarden

Posts.Content: Oct 1, 2010 05:52PM EllieD wrote: 3 years!  Woo Hoo
